intro: Psydrax mutimushii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a tropical tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, flame-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species. Due to its rapid growth and showy appearance, it is often used in landscaping and as a shade tree in warmer climates.
